questions.clue: This ancient wonder of Egypt is the only one of the original Seven Wonders still largely intact.
Completed in 1937, this iconic orange-red suspension bridge connects San Francisco to Marin County.
Built by the Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan, this white marble mausoleum is one of India's most famous landmarks.
This Roman amphitheater, known for gladiatorial contests, could hold up to 80,000 spectators.
This innovative temple complex built by the Khmer Empire is the largest religious structure in the world by land area.
This novel begins, 'Call me Ishmael.'
The opening line, 'It was the best of times, it was the worst of times,' is from this novel.
questions.answer: What is A Tale of Two Cities?

questions.clue: 'All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way,' starts this Russian classic.
This novel opens with, 'It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.'
The line, 'It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen,' introduces this dystopian novel.
In 1687, this scientist published 'Principia Mathematica', laying the groundwork for classical mechanics.
In 1869, Dmitri Mendeleev created this table that organized chemical elements by atomic mass.
In 1928, Alexander Fleming discovered this antibiotic, which was the first true antibiotic discovered.
This theory, proposed by Albert Einstein in 1905, revolutionized our understanding of time and space.
In 1953, James Watson and Francis Crick discovered the double helix structure of this molecule.
This Italian dish commonly features pasta, cheese, and tomato sauce and is often baked in layers.
In Japan, this dish of vinegared rice is often accompanied by raw fish, vegetables, or egg.
This spicy, fermented Korean side dish is made from napa cabbage and a variety of seasonings.
Originating from the Indian subcontinent, this dish involves marinated chicken cooked in a tandoor and is traditionally bright red.
This French dish from Provence is a slow-cooked stew of vegetables like zucchini, eggplant, and bell peppers.
This Greek hero is known for his 12 labors, which included slaying the Nemean Lion.
In Norse mythology, this hammer-wielding god is known for his strength and protection of mankind.
This legendary English outlaw is said to have stolen from the rich to give to the poor, often hiding in Sherwood Forest.
According to Japanese folklore, this nine-tailed fox spirit is known for its shape-shifting abilities and wisdom.
In the Finnish epic 'Kalevala', this wizard-hero is known for his magical songs and quests for a mystical artifact called the Sampo.

final.clue: This capital city, known as 'The City of a Hundred Spires', is home to a famous astronomical clock dating back to 1410.
